title: EMBEDDED LINUX DEVELOPER TO NEDERMAN
description:
*Embark on a transformative journey with Nederman, shaping the future of IoT solutions for air filtration systems. As our new* Embedded Linux Developer this is your chance to dive into cutting-edge technical innovation, work with highly skilled colleagues in a dynamic team, and elevate your career with us. If you want to contribute to solutions that make a tangible difference in the world, Nederman is the place for you. We go beyond products; we create solutions that make a real impact.  

  



*As we embrace a more interconnected future with our IoT-enabled solutions and our* new state-of-the-art office in Helsingborg, we invite passionate individuals to share our vision and be part of something truly transformative.

### **Our product**


Our digital platform goes beyond traditional filters, providing key insights to optimize performance, reduced costs, and enhance environmental compliance. With a focus on connectivity, our OTC program spans cloud and gateway development, operations, and support, uniting industrial equipment seamlessly. Currently, our IoT-platform boasts a substantial client base and 15+ persons working with Nederman OTC. Looking ahead, we aim to standardize and transition from AWS to Cumulocity and expanding our in-house team with more skilled professionals. Our strategic goals include developing an on-prem IoT solution, connecting diverse industrial applications, and delivering on new platforms.  

  



### **What you will do**


As our new Embedded Linux Developer, you will play a crucial role in developing our on-premises edge computing solutions. The product you will be working on is designed to handle all collection, saving and visualization of data on machines. The edge computer also sends data to cloud solutions and provides the same data to other consumers on-site through fieldbus protocols and others. The applications are packaged and managed as Docker containers, with different containers dedicated to data collection, storage, and web servers for data visualization.


We currently use C/C++, Python and C# in our stack, but we’re transitioning to Rust to bring our next-generation platform to life. Down the road, we’re excited to integrate machine learning models for predictive analytics—helping our clients stay one step ahead by solving problems before they even happen. Your main tasks will include:  

  



* Collaborating with cross-functional teams to ensure seamless integration between hardware and software.
* Future development that will include integrating machine learning for predictive analytics
* Develop Docker containers for data collection, storage, and web servers
* Work with Yocto and Buildroot to create and customize Linux distributions for our edge devices, while also developing and maintaining Linux-based systems.
* To ensure seamless data transmission to cloud solutions and clients through APIs
* Engage in new development initiatives to enhance our edge computing solutions.

### **We believe you have**


We are looking for someone with a strong background and several years’ experience in embedded systems and a strong background in Linux environments. Proficiency in C#, Rust, Python, and/or C/C++ is essential. You should have hands-on expertise in developing and managing custom Linux distributions using for example Yocto and Buildroot, as well as practical experience with Docker. We value individuals who are comfortable working with networking related tasks such as configuration and troubleshooting, additionally frontend knowledge is valuable even though it is not the primary focus.


We are looking for individuals who are self-motivated, flexible, and resilient, committed to growing within a fast-paced and rewarding global environment. A collaborative spirit, positive attitude, and strong work ethic are essential qualities. You should be organized and capable of managing multiple requests and tasks effectively. A proactive, can-do approach is crucial, alongside excellent listening, organizational, communication, and interpersonal skills. If you’re ready to take on responsibility and thrive in an environment where you can make a meaningful impact, we want to hear from you!  

  



### **What we offer you**


At Nederman, you are part of a fast-growing international company with sustainability at its core, where your work contributes to efficient production, environmental benefits, and safer workplaces worldwide. Our culture is characterized by employees who care for each other and the planet, demonstrating the courage to act. We value continuous learning and offer extensive opportunities for you to develop your skills and knowledge through our global training platform.


At our headquarters in Helsingborg, we are thrilled to have moved into our new world-class facilities. Along with being part of this exciting journey, you will enjoy market-competitive compensation and benefits, including a generous annual healthcare allowance, as well as access to our local canteen, which serves subsidized lunches daily

### **Apply today**


We are collaborating with Nexer Recruit regarding this recruitment. Please contact recruitment consultant Johanna Värmfors at Johanna.varmfors@nexergroup.com, or +46 730 821 230 or Artan Bitiqi at artan.bitiqi@nexergroup.com, or call +46 723 61 28 44 should you want to learn more about the position. We are looking forward to hearing from you!

### **About Nederman**

*At Nederman, we believe our role is to make life better by creating great products and solutions that protect people, planet and production. With around 2 100 employees, sales offices and distributors in over 50 countries and production in 12 countries on five continents, we´re one of the world's leading companies supplying products and solutions in the environmental technology sector focusing on industrial air filtration. We respect the environment and each other, have the courage to act and a sustainable customer focus. Listed on Nasdaq Stockholm Mid Cap. We are the Clean Air Company.*

title: BI-Utvecklare
description:
Länsförsäkringar är i en spännande expansionsfas och omvandlar verksamheten till att bli alltmer datadriven. Som Sveriges största sakförsäkringsbolag har vi enorma mängder outforskad data som väntar på att ge oss nya insikter. Bli en nyckelspelare i vårt team och forma framtidens affärsbeslut med din expertis!  


**Om jobbet**
Nu letar vi efter en teknisk BI-utvecklare med ett analytiskt sinne. Du kommer att skapa och underhålla rapporter som ger Länsförsäkringsbolagen data och information för att kunna styra våra försäkringsportföljer på ett effektivt sätt. Du kommer vara en viktig del för att hjälpa LF att skapa och förbättra portföljstyrningsförmågan inom försäkringsaffären samt skapa möjligheter att analysera och få insikter i LF-gruppens samlade affär.
Vi jobbar enligt agila arbetsmetoder och strävar efter att vara kompetensmässigt T-formade och hjälpa varandra där det behövs. Vår strävan är att du ska få möjlighet att utvecklas både inom affären och tekniken.
Som vår nästa BI-utvecklare kommer du att:
* Skapa och underhålla BI-rapporter och dashboards som stödjer affärsbeslut
* Skapa värdefulla insikter av stora mängder data.
* Bistå med teknisk kravställning för datamodellering och systemutveckling
* Hjälpa och utbilda våra intressenter med att förstå datamodeller, mätvärden och rapportobjekt.

  


**Vem är du?**
För att bli framgångsrik i denna roll ser vi att du har:
* Minst 3 års arbetslivserfarenhet som DW/BI utvecklare
* God erfarenhet av att visualisera data i Power BI
* Gedigen erfarenhet av SQL (SSMS)
* Förmåga att modellera data
* Erfarenhet av ETL-processer
* Erfarenhet av att designa, utveckla och underhålla datalager (Data Warehousing)
* Kompetens i att optimera databasprestanda och säkerställa dataintegritet
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med olika datakällor och integrationer
* Mycket god förmåga att uttrycka dig i tal och skrift på svenska och engelska.

  


Det är meriterande om du har:
* Erfarenhet av Oracle
* Erfarenhet av att bygga kuber (SSAS)
* Kunskaper i Python och/eller Powershell
* Erfarenhet av Azure
* Kunskaper i Git
* Erfarenhet av DevOps

  


Du har ett starkt intresse för hur affären fungerar och hur tekniken på bästa sätt kan stötta affär. Du tycker det är roligt att analysera data och skapa datamodeller, mätvärden och rapportobjekt som visar möjligheter och utmaningar på bästa möjliga sätt. Du har en förmåga att kommunicera tekniska koncept till icke-tekniska intressenter samt att du skapar engagerande och informativa datahistorier. (  


Som person är du öppen och har en pedagogisk förmåga att dela med dig av din kunskap. Du har en förmåga att arbeta både självständigt och i team. Du gillar ett högt tempo med många komplexa frågor samtidigt och har ett lösningsorienterat förhållningssätt till ditt arbete och din omgivning.  

**Om oss**
Gruppen PM&BI består idag av 11 engagerade medarbetare med djup expertis inom analys, uppföljning och visualisering av LF-gruppens samlade affär. Tillsammans kompletterar vi varandra med att stödja hela länsförsäkringsgruppens behov av datadriven affärs- och kundinsikt och som bidrar till att bygga kundlojalitet och lönsamma, långsiktiga kundrelationer.  

**Mer information**
*Låter det spännande?* *Då vill vi veta mer om dig! Välkommen med din ansökan redan idag. Vi arbetar löpande med denna rekrytering och kan komma att tillsätta tjänsten innan sista ansökningsdag.*  


**Sista ansökningsdag:** **2025-01-14**
  
Kort om tjänsten


**Anställningsform:** Tillsvidare
**Arbetsplats:** Stockholm
**Chef:** Henrik Andersson
**Kontaktuppgifter:** henrik.g.andersson@lansforsakringar.se
Vill du vara en del av lösningen, när livet förändras?


Bli en del av något större och börja jobba hos oss. En karriär hos Länsförsäkringar handlar lika mycket om att vara en hjälpande hand för våra kunder genom alla livets skeenden som att stärka lokalsamhället där du verkar.
company_description: Vill du vara en del av lösningen, när livet förändras?

title: BI-utvecklare inom Data & Analytics
description:
Data & Analytics-gruppen på LKAB förvandlar rådata till gyllene insikter, driver strategiska beslut och skapar framtidens innovationer – gå med oss och var med att forma morgondagens affärslandskap!


Ort: Luleå, Kiruna, Malmberget
Anställningsform: Tillsvidare
Ansök senast: 2025-02-09  


**Framtidens viktigaste jobb**
------------------------------


Vi vill leda omställningen av vår industri mot en hållbar framtid. Och på samma sätt som vi vill förändra världen, vill vi utveckla alla som är med oss på resan, personligt och professionellt. Vill du vara med och forma framtiden för världens gruv- och mineralindustri?



**Det här har du med dig**
--------------------------


I rollen kommer du att arbeta med att samla in, bearbeta och analysera stora datamängder för att extrahera användbara insikter. Dessa insikter används för att stödja beslutsfattande, förutse trender och optimera affärsprocesser inom företaget.



Som en BI-utvecklare fokuserar du på att designa, utveckla och underhålla BI-lösningar som hjälper LKAB att fatta datadrivna beslut. Du kommer att skapa lösningar för rapportering och visualisering av data, som dashboards och rapporter, för att göra komplex information begriplig och tillgänglig för beslutsfattare.



För att lyckas tror vi att du har erfarenhet inom något eller några av följande områden:



* Erfarenhet av BI-utveckling
* Förståelse för star-schema datamodellering
* Kunskaper inom ETL, Power BI, SQL eller Python
* Är konsultmässig, arbetar relationsskapande och har lätt för att få förtroende från verksamhet, kollegor och leverantörer.
* Kan formulera dig väl i tal och skrift både på svenska och engelska.
* Du har universitets- eller högskoleutbildning med IT-inriktning alternativt motsvarande arbetslivserfarenhet.


B-körkort och gymnasial examen är ett krav för alla tjänster inom LKAB.



**Det här får du**
------------------

* Motivationsprogram som belönar framgång
* Friskvård och studiestöd samt tillgång till konstförening, fritidsförening, fjällstugor och familjeaktiviteter
* Förstärkt föräldrapenning med upp till 90% av din ordinarie lön i upp till sex månader. (Efter anställning i ett år)
* Hjälp med stöd vid sjukdom eller frågor om arbetsmiljö, hälsa, friskvård och rehabilitering
* Skydds- och terminalglasögon samt ersättning för tandvård
* Möjlighet att ansöka om stipendier både för dig och dina barn

**Övrig information**
---------------------


Välkommen in med CV och personligt brev senast .



På LKAB värderar och eftersträvar vi mångfald och en jämn könsfördelning inom avdelningarna. Bifoga ett personligt brev och ditt CV. Intervjuer och urval sker löpande, så vänta inte med din ansökan. Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!



För mer information om tjänsten vänligen kontakta rekryterande chef Daniel Nordvall, 072-707 67 01 alt. daniel.nordvall@lkab.com.



Kiruna/Svappavaara



Unionen, Sakari Alanko, 0980-725 08



Akademikerföreningen, Peter Johansson, 0980-718 79



Ledarna, Ingegerd Kyrö, 0980-710 50



Malmberget/Luleå



Unionen Södra Katarina Paganus, 0970-762 98



SACO-klubben Södra – Annika Taavoniku, 0970-795 32



Ledarna Södra – Christer Olofsson, 0970-765 84

title: Product Developer / CAD Engineer
description:
CAD Engineer/ Product developer for High-Tech Products
  
Are you a skilled and passionate Product developer /CAD engineer looking for a stimulating and diverse area of work? If so, NYFORS invites you to join our team of development engineers, mechanical engineers, and physicists dedicated to developing high-tech fiber processing equipment.
  
THE TEAM
  
We are a skillful and passionate team with high competence in our area. The team includes development engineers, mechanical engineers and physicists all dedicated to developing new innovative, high-tech products and systems for fiber optic appplications.
  
We think it’s exciting to see all parts come together, software and hardware, and see the end products be successfully used by our customers.
  
THE POSITION
  
As a CAD engineer, you will have the opportunity to mix theory with practice and be responsible for evolving NYFORS' current product portfolio and developing completely new products.
  
We work in SolidWorks and are looking for a civil engineer with a technical interest and a high sense of responsibility. The role requires accuracy and focus on results, and you should feel confident in your professional role, as you should be able to work independently.
  
The work at NYFORS is cross-border and dynamic, and you will have the opportunity to work broadly and simultaneously both theoretically and practically. It is also an advantage if you have experience with various manufacturing processes.
  
YOUR BACKGROUND
  
Ideally, you have worked as a CAD engineer for at least two-five years, with experience from different industries and insight into different manufacturing methods. Even younger engineers with the right profile have the opportunity for employment.
  
WE CAN OFFER
  
At NYFORS, we offer versatile and stimulating work with the opportunity to develop and broaden your knowledge and skills. You will work in bright and pleasant premises at our head office in Skrubba, Stockholm, and we encourage a healthy work-life balance by offering our employees flexible working hours.
  
We value diversity highly and have employees from five different countries. Our goal is to create a long-term, rewarding, and fun collaboration together with you.
  
APPLICATION
  
If you are interested in this exciting opportunity, please submit your application as soon as possible. We will conduct interviews on an ongoing basis, so please apply as soon as you can. However, the final application deadline is March15,2025. Your application should include your CV and a personal letter where you tell us more about who you are and how you can contribute to this role and to NYFORS as a company.
  
ABOUT NYFORS
  
NYFORS is an innovative company moving at the fore-front of technology. As such we are looking for top applicants and strongly believe in investing in our employees. We encourage all our employees to develop the skills they are most interested in while working here. Our people are our strongest asset and what enables NYFORS’ continued success. Here you will get the opportunity to work with modern, high-tech equipment with dedicated co-workers.

title: AI Developer
description:
**Xensam:** SAM DisruptersXensam is the leading provider of AI-powered, cloud-hosted Software Asset Management technology. We’re looking for key players to join us as we scale our impact and build the Xensam team together. We take our culture seriously and strive to maintain the excellence, energy & enthusiasm that flows through the organization today.
  
We look for candidates who are passionate about what they do and ready to work the Xensam way. We know that experience counts, but we also know that it’s you, the person behind the experience, that makes it count.
  
About the roleWe at Xensam are seeking an innovative and skilled AI Developer to join our dynamic team. This role is ideal for someone with a passion for cutting-edge machine learning and artificial intelligence technologies.
  
As our AI Developer, youwill be instrumental in designing, implementing, and deploying advanced AI models, with a strong focus on LLM and NLP.
  
ResponsibilitiesYou willdevelop and fine-tune AI models, including supervised, unsupervised, and reinforcement learning techniques.You will alsodesign and implement LLM and NLP models, employing techniques like LoRA and adapters for optimal performance.Other responsibilities that you will have:
  
Preprocess and engineer features for large-scale datasets, ensuring readiness for model training.
  
Deploy ML models to production using MLOps practices, containerization tools (e.g., Docker), and cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP).
  
Utilize frameworks such as TensorFlow and PyTorch for neural network and ML model development.
  
Optimize and evaluate model performance, implementing tuning strategies to improve results.
  
Collaborate with multipleteams using Git, CI/CD pipelines, and Agile methodologies to deliver high-quality solutions.
  
  

Qualifications
  
Bachelor’s or higher degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Mathematics, or a related field.
  
Strong understanding of data structures, algorithms, and statistical methods.
  
Proficiency in Python, with experience in NN and ML frameworks like TensorFlow and PyTorch.
  
Experience in deploying machine learning models into production environments using MLOps best practices.
  
Familiarity with containerization tools (e.g., Docker) and cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP).
  
Expertise in preprocessing large datasets and performing feature engineering for LLM training.
  
Experience in training and fine-tuning LLMs and NLP models.
  
Familiarity with Git, CI/CD pipelines, and effective collaboration within multidisciplinary teams, communicating technical concepts clearly.
  
Familiarity with Agile methodologies and experience working in an Agile team.
  
Strong proficiency in written and spoken English and preferably Swedish.
  
  

What you get
  
A dynamic position embracing "freedom under responsibility".
  
Three days in-office (with remote work on Mondays and Fridays).
  
Free access to beverages, snacks, gym facilities, on-site massage, shuffleboard, and other games.
  
If sales targets are met, all employees enjoy an annual destination trip.
  
Join an ambitious and diverse team, and work with cutting-edge technology in the fastest-growing SAM software on the market.
  
An opportunity to shape your career growth while contributing to the company’s success.
  
  

**At Xensam, our core values define our culture:**  

**Rebellious:** We encourage a spirit of freedom and initiative within responsibility.
  
**Humane:** We foster a caring, inclusive environment that values diversity and respects individuality.
  
**Harmonious:** We promote work-life balance, creating a pleasant, supportive workplace.
  
  

Join Xensam for a balanced, collaborative, and growth-focused work environment. If you're a team player ready to thrive, APPLY now!
  
As part of our recruitment process, we conduct background checks on final candidates to fulfill our commitments to customers and ensure a safe work environment.

title: C++ Developer

We take our culture seriously and strive to maintain the excellence, energy & enthusiasm that flows through the organization today.

title: Senior Embedded Linux utvecklare
description:
*På TechSeed är vi övertygade om att det är tekniken som kommer göra världen till en bättre plats. Vi ser ett stort behov i vårt samhälle att kombinera affärsförståelse, digitalt ledarskap samt innovativa arbetssätt och lösningar med framtidens tekniker i uppkopplade ekosystem. Vi tror på en hållbar framtid med säkra lösningar genom exempelvis IoT-lösningar, digitala tvillingar, AI och cybersäkerhet. Det här är vårt WHY och det fyller oss med energi varje dag. Det här är vår arena.*


TechSeed är ett medarbetarägt bolag som erbjuder konsulttjänster och har ett kompetensdjup inom flera domäner. Vi är på en kraftig tillväxtresa och söker nu **Senior Embedded Linux utvecklare** som även kommer få en stor grad av inflytande och insyn i hur vi växer framåt och tar ett helhetsgrepp om uppkopplade ekosystem och lösningar. Vi söker dig som trivs i konsultrollen och samtidigt vill bidra till att skapa vägen framåt för TechSeed – Tillsammans.

 **Vill du vara en del av en visionär resa där teknologiska innovationer förändrar världen, en kodrad i taget – och samtidigt bli delägare i företaget?**


TechSeed Things Mälardalen söker nu en driven **Embedded Linux-utvecklare** med erfarenhet av OTA-uppdateringar och Qt för att skapa framtidens lösningar inom inbyggda system.

 **Om oss**


På TechSeed Things Mälardalen samlar vi ett team av kreativa och innovationsdrivna ingenjörer – vår egen **Things Crew** – som lyfter våra kunders visioner från det okända till en bättre verklighet. Vi är en ledande aktör inom inbyggda system och fokuserar på att skapa hållbara lösningar som kopplar sensorer till molnet för en smartare och mer uppkopplad värld.


Hos oss är du inte bara en anställd – du är **delägare i företaget**. Vi tror på att dela framgång och ansvar med våra medarbetare, vilket gör att vi tillsammans driver bolaget framåt mot nya höjder.

**Om rollen**


Som Senior embedded Linux-utvecklare hos oss kommer du att:

* Designa och utveckla applikationer och system för **Embedded Linux-plattformar** med hjälp av **Qt** för att skapa användarvänliga och kraftfulla gränssnitt.
* Implementera och optimera **OTA-uppdateringssystem** för att säkerställa pålitliga och smidiga uppdateringar i fält.
* Integrera och testa mjukvara för inbyggda system, med fokus på robusthet och prestanda.
* Arbeta nära våra kunder för att förstå deras behov och skapa skräddarsydda lösningar som uppfyller deras visioner.
* Delta i projekt som utforskar ny teknik, från prototyper till färdiga produkter.

**Vi söker dig som:**

* Har en examen inom datateknik, elektronik eller motsvarande område.
* Har erfarenhet av **Embedded Linux-utveckling**, inklusive bootloaders, filsystem och drivrutiner.
* Behärskar **Qt** för GUI-utveckling och har kunskap om C++ och objektorienterad programmering.
* Har erfarenhet av att implementera **OTA-uppdateringssystem** och förståelse för nätverkskommunikation och säkerhet.
* Är en problemlösare som är nyfiken, noggrann och trivs i en innovativ miljö.

 **Om TechSeed**

  

Vi är ett medarbetarägt konsultbolag i ScaleUp-fasen med visionen att skapa värde med uppkopplade lösningar. Vi tror på kombinationen av nära samarbeten, framtidens tekniker och att gemensamt arbeta för att skapa ett bolag vi verkligen trivs på. Genom att erbjuda delägarskap till våra anställda ger vi möjligheten till insyn och påverkan, samtidigt som det gynnar samarbeten och att prioritera vad som är bäst för gruppen. Detta speglas både i vår kultur och våra erbjudanden, där vi kombinerar vårt stora tekniska intresse med ett kundanpassat förhållningssätt samtidigt som vi har många sociala aktiviteter och en härlig gemenskap på kontoret. Vår arena är uppkopplade ekosystem, där tekniker som IoT och Intelligent Edge används för att skapa uppkopplade tjänster och system inom ekosystem som Smart Cities, Smart Factories, Smart Companies och Smart Buildings.

title: Developer Internship (Python &/or TypeScript/JavaScript) - Gain Hands-On Experience at an Award-Winning Google Cloud Partner
Business Intelligence Developer
description:
**Job Advert: BI Developer / BI Specialist – Stockholm, Sweden** 




**Unlock the Power of Data at Bauer Media Sweden** 




  





 Are you passionate about turning raw data into actionable insights? Do you thrive in an innovative environment where you can leave your mark? Bauer Media Sweden is looking for a talented
 **BI Developer/BI Specialist** 
 to join our Data & Systems team and help shape the future of business intelligence for the leading audio company in Europe.
 



  





**What You’ll Do** 




 As a BI Developer, you’ll be at the forefront of driving data-driven decision-making at Bauer Media Sweden.
 



  





 You will:
 


* Design, develop, and maintain
 **Power BI dashboards** 
 to empower teams with real-time insights.
* Take ownership of
 **end-to-end data projects** 
 , from requirements gathering to delivery and evaluation.
* Oversee
 **ETL processes**

title: Frontend Developer TM 4.0
description:
Do you want to take on a Frontend Developer role where you can impact other developers with ways of working? Great! At Sandvik Machining Solutions we’re now looking for a new colleague to join us!
   

  

 Welcome to a collaborative and dynamic team with a growth-oriented culture operating in a hybrid setting – allowing for flexibility in how we work together. We’re eager to meet you!
   

  

**About Your Job**
 In this position, you develop and set the standards for frontend development within our Cloud Technology team with initial focus on our next generation tool management solutions TM 4.0 – ensuring high-quality code and optimal performance. You collaborate closely with designers and other developers, acting as owner of the Cloud Technology Design system and component build-up. You belong to our Division Tool Flow Solutions, we currently manage product as CRIBWISE, TM 4.0 and TDM WebCatalogue.
   

  

 Included in your responsibilities:
   

  

* Develop frontend features using Angular.
* Translate design mockups into functional code.
* Build reusable components.
* Optimize applications for speed, security and scalability.
* Act as the gate keeper for frontend development frameworks.


 The location is either at our modern site at Gasverket in Stockholm, Sweden or in Tübingen, Germany. We offer you a hybrid work solution.
   

  

 Your profile
   

  

 We’re looking for someone with proven experience from frontend architecture development with a focus on Angular. Strong proficiency in HTML, CSS and Typescript is a must, as well as knowledge of version control systems, particularly Git. You need familiarity in frontend testing frameworks (e.g., Jest, Playwright), responsive design, cross-browser compatibility and performance optimization. You also need experience with RESTful APIs and integrating frontend applications with backend services. We believe that your knowledge is backed by a university degree within IT or similar experience. Acting in a truly global environment calls for excellent English skills, verbally and in writing.
   

  

 With confidence in yourself and your knowledge, you can make informed decisions under pressure. As a true team player, you’re an excellent collaborator and communicator who works effectively within a team and across departments. Your problem-solving and strong analytical skills enable you to troubleshoot and resolve issues. With attention to detail, you ensure high-quality code and user experience. At the end of the day, you always aim to adapt your work by staying current with new technologies and trends.
   

  

**Our culture**
 At Sandvik, we’re tech driven, innovative and entrepreneurial. We believe that success is a team effort so we value diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive culture where people can be themselves and reach their full potential. So, we invest in supporting each other, learning together and celebrating our differences. Visit our stories hub, LinkedIn or Facebook to get to know us further.
   

  

**Contact information**
 For further information about this position, please contact Patrik Grönman, recruiting manager, patrik.gronman@sandvik.com
   

  

 At Sandvik, we value work-life balance and due to the holidays, it may be difficult to reach us.
   

  

 We’ve already decided on which advertising channels and marketing campaigns we wish to use and respectfully decline any additional contacts in that matter.
   

  

 Union contacts – Sweden
   

  

* Thomas Lilja, Unionen, +46 (0)70 261 04 82
* Göran Norell, Akademikerföreningen, +46 (0)70 616 43 78
* Peter Olsson-Andrée, Ledarna, +46 (0)70 222 48 55


 Recruitment Specialist: Gustaf Sjögren
   

  

**How To Apply**
 Send your application no later than January 7th, 2024. Click apply and include your resume and cover letter in English. Please note that we don’t accept applications by e-mail. Job ID: R0073097.
   

  

 As we aim for a fair recruitment process, we utilize assessment tools to safeguard objectivity. When you apply for this job, you will therefore receive an invitation via email to a personality and logic ability test. Feedback comes immediately after the test has been completed and the selection process begins after the application deadline.
   

  

 To learn more about our recruitment process, please visit our career site or contact HR Services at hrservices.sweden@sandvik.com.
   

  

*Sandvik Manufacturing and Machining Solutions is a business area within the Sandvik Group and a global market-leading manufacturer of tools and tooling systems for advanced industrial metal cutting. The business area also comprises the areas of additive manufacturing and digital manufacturing solutions. In 2023, sales were approximately 49 billion SEK with about 20,300 employees.*

title: Developer Support Engineer for Data Calling
description:
**About Sinch**
 Sinch is pioneering the way the world communicates. More than 150,000 businesses — including Google, Uber, Paypal, Visa, Tinder, and many others — rely on Sinch's Customer Communications Cloud to power engaging customer experiences through mobile messaging, voice, and email.
   

  

 Whether you need to verify users or craft omnichannel campaigns, Sinch makes it easy. Our AI-infused Super Network, APIs, and applications ensure you can connect with your customers reliably and securely, at every step of their journey.
   

  

 At Sinch we "Dream Big", "Win Together", "Keep it simple", and "Make it Happen". These values are our foundation!
   

  

**Description**
 As a Developer Support Engineer, you will be responsible for enhancing the developer experience by continuously improving our reference implementations, sample apps, and documentation, while providing top-notch support to our clients' developers. You'll troubleshoot customer integrations of our SDKs and APIs, track FAQs, and identify patterns that highlight potential SDK improvements. Our SDKs use WebRTC technology, making it easy to add real-time, in-app voice and video calling to our clients' websites or apps.
   

  

* Handle and analyse third-line support inquiries to ensure our FAQs remain relevant.
* Help keep our developer documentation up-to-date and user-friendly.
* Build reference implementations and sample apps to simplify the integration of our voice, video, and verification SDKs.
* Collaborate closely with other engineers to stay informed about important updates and new releases.
* Focus on quality assurance and provide first-class support to developers.
* Communicate effectively with clients, ensuring their technical issues are resolved promptly and clearly.
* Conduct QA testing of SDKs on mobile devices to ensure optimal performance and usability.


**Requirements**
* Degree in IT, engineering, or a related field, or equivalent work experience.
* High proficiency in English, particularly in writing.
* Strong communication skills, with experience in handling customer support.
* Experience in app development or relevant development roles.
* Strong understanding of the development process and effective communication with developers.
* Interest in voice and video calling technologies.


**Good to have**
* Familiarity with Android and iOS application development (Kotlin, Swift).
* Experience of using tools such as Datadog and Kibana for monitoring systems and performing root cause analysis through detailed log and metric exploration.
* Previous experience in a similar support role.
* Experience with voice and video calling.
* Familiarity with WebRTC technology, IP networks or telecom networks.
* Experience in manual and automated QA testing of SDKs on mobile devices.


**Our Hiring Process**
 We are committed to ensuring a recruitment process that is fair, objective, consistent, and inclusive. Our approach includes structured, competency-based interviews designed to evaluate your skills, experience, and qualifications relevant to the role. At times, we may include a data-driven assessment to enhance our hiring success and identify candidates likely to excel.
   

  

 We believe in a two-way process and encourage you to ask questions throughout the journey. If this role isn't what you're looking for, please explore the other opportunities listed on our career page: https://www.sinch.com/careers/. No matter who you are, we hope you find an exciting path forward - hopefully with us!

title: Associate Software Engineer
company_industry: Software Development, Computer and Network Security, and Information Technology & Services
description:
Flexera saves customers billions of dollars in wasted technology spend. A pioneer in Hybrid ITAM and FinOps, Flexera provides award-winning, data-oriented SaaS solutions for technology value optimization (TVO), enabling IT, finance, procurement and cloud teams to gain deep insights into cost optimization, compliance and risks for each business service. Flexera One solutions are built on a set of definitive customer, supplier and industry data, powered by our Technology Intelligence Platform, that enables organizations to visualize their Enterprise Technology Blueprint™ in hybrid environments—from on-premises to SaaS to containers to cloud.
   

  

 We’re transforming the software industry.  We’re Flexera.  With
 **more than 50,000 customers** 
 across the world, we’re achieving that goal. But we know we can’t do any of that without our team. Ready to help us re-imagine the industry during a time of substantial growth and ambitious plans?  Come and see why
 **we’re consistently recognized by Gartner, Forrester and IDC** 
 as a category leader in the marketplace. Learn more at
 **flexera.com**
 As an Associate Software Engineer at Flexera, you will leverage basic experience to develop, and optimize real-world software solutions, ranging from classic on-premise software to microservices running in complex cloud architectures. You will adopt and implement best practices in C# .NET development, database development, and messaging technologies like NATS. Your contribution will help maintain the quality of our products and ensure the success of our innovative software solutions.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Maintain existing code (C# .NET, T-SQL) for our on-premise and cloud solutions to address issues reported by customers or internally
* Implement features on a classic codebase to extend the functionality of our on-premise solutions using C# .NET.
* Implement features on a scalable and high-performance microservices architecture using C# .NET, ensuring reliability and efficiency.
* Implement features that rely on messaging solutions using NATS to facilitate smooth communication between microservices.
* Implement RESTful and Asynchronous APIs.
* Implement unit testing for existing and new code.
* Work closely with the rest of the team.


**Qualifications**
* Teamwork: the candidate must be capable of effective teamwork and foster a positive work environment.
* Communication: Strong verbal and written communication skills, capable of effective collaboration with cross-functional teams.
* Personal growth: the candidate must demonstrate an attitude for self-improvement, learning, and growth with an open mindset.
* Problem-Solving: problem-solving skills with a proactive approach to identifying and resolving complex issues.
* Experience:
+ basic software development experience, with a focus on C# .NET.
+ basic database development experience with T-SQL and similar technologies.

* Technical Skills:
+ Moderate expertise in C# .NET and in T-SQL.
+ Understanding the principles of messaging technologies such as NATS.
+ Understanding the principles of RESTful and Asynchronous APIs.
+ Familiarity with Integrated Development Environments, Git/GitHub, CICD pipelines.
+ Familiarity with Agile/Scrum methodologies and practices.


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Understanding of our classical and cloud solutions, their purpose, userbase, and structure.
* Understanding of MongoDB or other NoSQL databases for database management and integration.


**Education**
* Degree in computer science, Engineering, or a related field; advanced degrees or certifications are a plus. Equivalent substantial related experience in software engineering will also be considered.


 Flexera is proud to be an equal opportunity employer.  Qualified applicants will be considered for open roles regardless of age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by local/national laws, policies and/or regulations.
   

  

 Flexera understands the value that results from employing a diverse, equitable, and inclusive workforce. We recognize that equity necessitates acknowledging past exclusion and that inclusion requires intentional effort. Our DEI (Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion) council is the driving force behind our commitment to championing policies and practices that foster a welcoming environment for all.
   

  

 We encourage candidates requiring accommodations to please let us know by emailing careers@flexera.com.

title: Senior Frontend Engineer
description:
Do you want to challenge the status quo and be a part of the disruptive innovation that’s changing the traditional banking services?
   

  

 Do you want to work in an entrepreneurial environment yet have all the perks from being a part of an international media company?
   

  

 If yes, then take the opportunity to join the FinTech superstar Lendo. Lendo has already established a strong position in the Nordics. The newly acquired PSD2 licence creates opportunities in open banking, enabling us to further develop our value proposition and drive scalability in more markets.
   

  

**What You Tell Your Friends You Do**
 I am a developer at Lendo, where I'm enhancing proven products and establishing new ones within the loan comparison, account services and payment areas.
   

  

**What You Will Really Be Doing**
* Use a modern technology stack such as React, Javascript, Kubernetes, Docker, RabbitMQ, PostgreSQL...etc.
* Create exciting new products and features
* Build, lead, design and optimize components to make them reusable for Lendo in multiple countries
* Build software that is used daily by a great number of user
* Take ownership of our projects and products!
* Collaborate closely with colleagues and the business to increase value for our users
* Prioritize work with the team and its Product Owner.
* Write tests at different levels to ensure quality and that your code really does what you want
* Identify and keep track of metrics that tell you how your software is performing
* Be creative and brainstorm ideas for ways we can further streamline our development
* Bring your own unique skill set to the table
* You’ll become part of an international, agile, multidisciplinary team that loves to discuss and solve problems in the group.
* You’ll experiment, test, try, fail and learn all the time


**We offer**
* A place for everyone - You are welcome at Lendo for who you are, no matter where you come from or what you look like. Our product is for everyone, and so is our workplace!
* Room for you to do things your way
* We like to inspire your passion by organizing hackathons and other knowledge-sharing event
* A wellness program, if you want to do yoga, meditation, running and other activities with colleagues and coaches
* 4 000 SEK health promotion allowance
* 30 days of paid leave
* Super central location in Stockholm with a awesome rooftop- Please note that this position is based in Stockholm and offers a hybrid workplace setup. The required office days are Tuesdays and Wednesdays.
* And yes, we also have the industry standard perks such as ping pong tables, team activities, and fun parties!

title: AI Developer
description:
**Xensam: SAM Disrupters** 




 Xensam is the leading provider of AI-powered, cloud-hosted Software Asset Management technology. We’re looking for key players to join us as we scale our impact and build the Xensam team together. We take our culture seriously and strive to maintain the excellence, energy & enthusiasm that flows through the organization today.
 



  





 We look for candidates who are passionate about what they do and ready to work the Xensam way. We know that experience counts, but we also know that it’s you, the person behind the experience, that makes it count.
 



  





**About the role** 




 We at Xensam are seeking an innovative and skilled AI Developer to join our dynamic team. This role is ideal for someone with a passion for cutting-edge machine learning and artificial intelligence technologies.
 



  





 As our AI Developer, you will be instrumental in designing, implementing, and deploying advanced AI models, with a strong focus on LLM and NLP.
 



  





**Responsibilities** 




 You will develop and fine-tune AI models, including supervised, unsupervised, and reinforcement learning techniques. You will also design and implement LLM and NLP models, employing techniques like LoRA and adapters for optimal performance. Other responsibilities that you will have:
 



  




* Preprocess and engineer features for large-scale datasets, ensuring readiness for model training.
* Deploy ML models to production using MLOps practices, containerization tools (e.g., Docker), and cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP).
* Utilize frameworks such as TensorFlow and PyTorch for neural network and ML model development.
* Optimize and evaluate model performance, implementing tuning strategies to improve results.
* Collaborate with multiple teams using Git, CI/CD pipelines, and Agile methodologies to deliver high-quality solutions.



  





**Qualifications** 



* Bachelor’s or higher degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Mathematics, or a related field.
* Strong understanding of data structures, algorithms, and statistical methods.
* Proficiency in Python, with experience in NN and ML frameworks like TensorFlow and PyTorch.
* Experience in deploying machine learning models into production environments using MLOps best practices.
* Familiarity with containerization tools (e.g., Docker) and cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP).
* Expertise in preprocessing large datasets and performing feature engineering for LLM training.
* Experience in training and fine-tuning LLMs and NLP models.
* Familiarity with Git, CI/CD pipelines, and effective collaboration within multidisciplinary teams, communicating technical concepts clearly.
* Familiarity with Agile methodologies and experience working in an Agile team.
* Strong proficiency in written and spoken English and preferably Swedish.



  





**What you get** 



* A dynamic position embracing "freedom under responsibility".
* Three days in-office (with remote work on Mondays and Fridays).
* Free access to beverages, snacks, gym facilities, on-site massage, shuffleboard, and other games.
* If sales targets are met, all employees enjoy an annual destination trip.
* Join an ambitious and diverse team, and work with cutting-edge technology in the fastest-growing SAM software on the market.
* An opportunity to shape your career growth while contributing to the company’s success.



  





**At Xensam, our core values define our culture** 




**Rebellious** 
 : We encourage a spirit of freedom and initiative within responsibility.
 



**Humane** 
 : We foster a caring, inclusive environment that values diversity and respects individuality.
 



**Harmonious** 
 : We promote work-life balance, creating a pleasant, supportive workplace.
 



 Join Xensam for a balanced, collaborative, and growth-focused work environment. If you're a team player ready to thrive,
 **APPLY now!** 




  





 As part of our recruitment process, we conduct background checks on final candidates to fulfill our commitments to customers and ensure a safe work environment.

title: Tech Lead Manager
description:
**About Sinch**
 Sinch is pioneering the way the world communicates. More than 150,000 businesses — including Google, Uber, Paypal, Visa, Tinder, and many others — rely on Sinch's Customer Communications Cloud to power engaging customer experiences through mobile messaging, voice, and email.
   

  

 Whether you need to verify users or craft omnichannel campaigns, Sinch makes it easy. Our AI-infused Super Network, APIs, and applications ensure you can connect with your customers reliably and securely, at every step of their journey.
   

  

 At Sinch we "Dream Big", "Win Together", "Keep it simple", and "Make it Happen". These values are our foundation!
   

  

**Description**
**Are you a skilled backend software developer ready to grow into a leadership role while staying hands-on in technology?** 
 Join us as a Tech Lead Manager, where you'll lead an empowered development team delivering scalable components for data optimization, billing, account management, and product configuration tooling.
   

  

 This role offers a perfect blend of leadership and technical contributions, giving you the opportunity to guide a team of developers while actively shaping the technical direction.
   

  

**Responsabilities**
* Define clear goals, coach your team members, and foster a collaborative, growth-oriented environment.
* Work closely with your product partner to plan and build the right solutions at the right time.
* Stay hands-on by contributing to backend development, driving DevOps practices, and supporting code reviews, testing, and quality assurance.
* Manage salaries, performance, and career development for your team members.
* Ensure high-quality, timely delivery of technical solutions that meet business needs.
* Balance people leadership with strong technical contributions, making yourself a go-to resource for the team.


**Requirements**
* Strong experience in backend development such as .NET or Java technologies.
* Hands-on knowledge of DevOps practices, including CI/CD and infrastructure as code, and Kubernetes.
* Experience with cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud
* Experience with code reviews, testing, and ensuring software quality.
* Proven leadership experience or a strong desire to grow into a management role.
* Excellent communication skills in English, with the ability to align stakeholders.
* A collaborative, goal-oriented mindset with the ability to inspire and support your team.


 Embrace the challenge and join us!
   

  

**Our Hiring Process**
 We are committed to ensuring a recruitment process that is fair, objective, consistent, and inclusive. Our approach includes structured, competency-based interviews designed to evaluate your skills, experience, and qualifications relevant to the role. title: Software Test Engineer
description:
*Do you want to make a difference in the field of surveillance and security?* 




*Are you a Test Engineer looking for your next challenge?* 




  





  





  





**ABOUT THE COMPANY** 




 We can't tell you which company it is but we promise that you won't be disappointed. Here are three clues for you:
 



 - They are technology leaders within surveillance technology
 



 - Their products help first responders and military personnel protect and save lives
 



 - The company was founded in 1978 where they became the pioneers within image systems for airborne applications.
 



  





**ABOUT THE ROLE** 




 In this role you will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining automated test scripts, ensuring comprehensive regression testing, and collaborating closely with QA analysts and developers to deliver high-quality software and hardware. You will also be responsible for using continuous integration to automate the integration of code changes and ensure that the integrated codebase is in a workable state.
 



**Primary Duties & Responsibilities:** 



* **Design and Develop Automation Scripts** 
 : Create and maintain automated test scripts using open-source tools, including Jenkins.
* **Bug Tracking and Documentation** 
 : Identify, record, and thoroughly document software bugs. Track their resolution.
* **Regression Testing** 
 : Perform comprehensive regression testing when bugs are fixed.
* **Requirements Review** 
 : Review requirements, specifications, and technical design documents to provide timely feedback.
* **Continuous integration monitoring and statistics** 
 : Identify and eliminate inefficiencies.
* **Test methodology and processes** 
 : Use best practices to ensure the application meets its intended purposes.



  





**WHO ARE YOU?** 




 To be successful in this role we believe that you have:
 


* Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field
* Experience with Automation Tools, proficiency in tools like Selenium, Appium, or JUnit
* Strong knowledge of programming languages such as Java, Python, C#
* Understanding of SDLC, familiarity with software development life cycle, testing methodologies and Atlassian



  





**BUT MOST IMPORTANTLY, WE BELIEVE THAT YOU ARE:** 




  




* Analytical with the ability to analyze requirements and design effective test cases
* Team player and able to collaborate with developers and other stakeholders
* Technically interested



  





**OTHER INFORMATION:** 




**Start:** 
 As per agreement
 



**Location:** 
 Täby, hybrid
 



**Employment:** 
 Fulltime employment directly with the customer
